item.title: Illegal no-parking cones, 14th October
item.description:

item.title: Fly-tipping, 14th October
item.description:
This is a regular area for fly-tipping and this has been for a least a couple of weeks. I reported this a couple of weeks ago and more has been added to it. It makes the area look terrible and encourages more people to think they can dump stuff here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frinsted Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed van parked badly., 14th October
item.description:
This White Ford transit has been dumped , I am sure.It has been parked on Cameron Road , right outside Mapleton Close , opposite Matfield Close , which causes a real obstruction , particularly if the buses happen to meet. There has been a sign posted on the window for about 10 days or so now saying it is untaxed. If it could be removed , would be doing everyone a favour.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnhill Avenue, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog waste all along the southern end of Holmdene Avenue on the even side of the road, 14th October
item.description:
There is a constant stream of dog waste on the even side of Holmdene Avenue from numbers 90 all the way up to 60. This road has a school at the bottom and has a large number of children on it at drop off and pick up time especially on the even side of the road. I counted 7 today of dog mess newly laid or been pressed into the pavement by children, parents, and other road walkers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holmdene Avenue, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burnt down bed blocking stairway, 14th October
item.description:
Excessive fly tipping all along the stairs. The fly tipping has caught fire (likely due to the drug addicts that sit in the area and smoke) fire brigade have put the fire out and left the ash. My children and I use this walkway everyday to get to school. It is heavily used by parents in the area. Please can this be removed. Please can this issue be further escalated? We need a camera and some deterrents here to keep it clean. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Sandy Hill Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
